intro: Centropogon aurostellatus, commonly known as the golden star grass, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, golden-yellow inflorescences that are clustered at the ends of its stems. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Centropogon aurostellatus is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
